alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:38AM EDT until July 28 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Floyd County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Knott County in southeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Letcher County in southeastern Kentucky... Southwestern Pike County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 430 AM EDT. * At 138 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hindman, Bath, Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Pippa Passes, Hall, Ivan, Greenleaf, Kite, Dry Creek, Omaha, Deane, Democrat, Halo, Drew, May, Topmost, Nealy, Hollybush and Lester. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
